history.text: I honestly loved the movie. It is a classic. However, I am always left wondering as to how they could have left their child at home... that's part of the comedy though! The comedy was always jumpy. Like jump scare tactics from horror movies....
I loved this movie too, so funny all the way through. I have wondered how could the parents have forgot about him and he got left behind at home too! But it was a hilarious movie!
Macaulay Culkin and Kevin Mccallister were perfect in this movie, and it took place during a really busy time of year, at christmas time.
Yeah it was! The booby traps were definitely sophisticated... But in my opinion it made the movie that much more hilarious! Like how could these burglars get tricked by this little 8 year old! Wow
Exactly! Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern were definatley tricked by the little 8 year old. That was the humour to this comedy through out.
Macaulay Culkin playin as the 8 year old kid Kevin McCalister , I will always remember from this movie, who outwitted two grown up men playing the burglars

I did however would have liked to know more about the family though... I mean what kind of job must the parents have in order to afford an amazing vacation for  11 children and themselves! That is nuts.
No wonder the burglars ( Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern) wanted to rob them. lol!
Left me to assume that one of them had a great job. A Christmas vacation in Paris with all the kids except one. Marley was a good neighbor Kevin soon found out while being home alone.
Kevin tried to get them to think his parents and family were at home but the burglars knew he was home alone on Christmas eve
